title: [BEAM-7240] Kinesis IO Watermark Computation Improvements
body:
Currently, watermarks in kinesis IO are computed taking into account the record arrival time in a `KinesisRecord`. The arrival time might not always be the right representation of the event time. Also, as the per current logic, the end user of the IO cannot control watermark computation in any way. This PR addresses these concerns through an interface `KinesisWatermarkPolicy`, through which an end user can provide custom watermark computation logic. I have also provided some standard watermark policies: - Arrival time policy: takes arrival time of the kinesis record as the event time - Processing time policy: returns`Instant.now()` as the current watermark - Custom watermark policy: which takes a `SerializableFunction` to extract an event time from the record. I have used a configurable watermark idle duration threshold for watermark computation. The watermark should be advanced once a watermark has not been updated for the threshold duration. This prevents the stalling of a watermark (in the event that a shard is stalled/down). title: [BEAM-7214] Run Python validates runner tests on Spark
body:
This PR implements the Gradle task `:beam-sdks-python:sparkValidatesRunner`, but it doesn't actually run it anywhere. - All the tests I expected to pass are passing (ran 33 tests, skipped 12), with the exception of `test_external_transforms` [BEAM-7232](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-7232); not sure what's up with that one. - I had to set `beam.spark.test.reuseSparkContext=true` to prevent Spark contexts from being reused, probably because of some concurrency issue. title: [BEAM-7229] ParDoLifecycleTest: remove duplicated test methods
body:
ParDoLifecycleTest contains following tests: testTeardownCalledAfterExceptionInStartBundle testTeardownCalledAfterExceptionInProcessElement testTeardownCalledAfterExceptionInFinishBundle testWithContextTeardownCalledAfterExceptionInStartBundle testWithContextTeardownCalledAfterExceptionInProcessElement testWithContextTeardownCalledAfterExceptionInFinishBundle The actual implementation of testTeardownCalledAfterExceptionIn* and the corresponding counterpart testWithContextTeardownCalledAfterExceptionIn* is identical. History shows, there some time has been a DoFnWithContext and a DoFn, which got renamed to DoFn and OldDoFn at about the time @Setup and @Teardown were introduced. Seemingly, there has never been a different implementation so probably on some rebase on the to be merged branch things got messed up. see [1] and [2] [1] https://github.com/apache/beam/commit/12abb1b02246b8d36021c7b1a970daf1b64ba4b9#diff-68ed88cc25171e30985dda4534e68c9b 12abb1b02246b8d36021c7b1a970daf1b64ba4b9 [2] https://github.com/apache/beam/commit/3bcb6f46ad0ae483d1d8785edc2d9d5846c71a73#diff-68ed88cc25171e30985dda4534e68c9b ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-5197] Guard access to test timer service by a lock
body:
This fixes a NPE in UnboundedSourceWrapperTest#testValueEmission. The processing timer queue could be concurrently accessed. To prevent this from happening, we must acquire the checkpoint lock before advancing time. title: [BEAM-6986] TypeHints Py3 Error: Multiple tests fail with a generator StopIteration error on Python 3.7
body:
Update to solve the problem with "Multiple tests fail with a generator StopIteration error on Python 3.7". The solution is based upon using a for loop instead of next where "The for loop listens for StopIteration explicitly." Please see this answer for a good explanation: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14413969/why-does-next-raise-a-stopiteration-but-for-do-a-normal-return Also of interest is the following: Change StopIteration handling inside generators https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0479/. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-5967] Add handling of DynamicMessage in ProtoCoder
body:
The ProtoCoder was unable to handle DynamicMessage as it was unable to get a message specific parser. The Coder is expanded to handle DynamicMessage as a special case. It stores the complete descriptor set when (de)serializing. Design decision: Although DynamicMessage could in theory have a different schema per message in a single stream this doesn't make sense. The common use-case for using DynamicMessages is when the schema is not known at compile type, but is known at pipeline build time (example, like pulled from a schema registry). With this restriction we only need to store the schema (or descriptor) once when the pipeline is serialized and send to the workers. **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7197] ensure DoFn is torn down after exception thrown in lifecycle method
body:
Caused by a bug in test implementation, missing calls to DoFns teardown method were hidden. This PR - fixes the bug in ParDoLifeCycleTest - implements missing calls to teardown revealed be the fixed tests - adds tests for stateful DoFn processing (required for e.g. flink which has distinct implementations) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-7220] add JavaReadViaImpulse substitution to Java expansion service
body:
The issue I tried to fix with #8396 can be solved by this PR. The problem was that `Read` transform which generates any other types than those covered by standard coders causes `ClassCastException`. Currently, `Read` transform is handled by `FlinkRunner` itself and `WireCoder` for runners only allows length-prefixed byte array coder for all non-standard types. We can fix `ClassCastException` by substituting `Read` transforms with `Impulse+DoFn` as we do in `PortableRunner`. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-6766] Add Sort Merge Bucket sink and join source
body:
Master ticket for the SMB work. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sort-merge_join BEAM issue: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-6766 cc: @nevillelyh , @reuvenlax , @kanterov This is a first pass that successfully runs on DataflowRunner with test input. There are a few To-Do items listed below, as well as much more thorough/modular unit tests to write, but we wanted some feedback on this initial design before continuing. Todo - [ ] support compression - [x] decouple intermediate layer e.g. `Metadata`, `FileOperations`, `BucketedInputIterator` for easy testing - [x] work around `JsonSubTypes` limit in `BucketMetadata` - [ ] reuse temp directory logic in `FileBasedSink` - [ ] reuse file handling logic in `FileBasedSink` - [x] support mixing sources of different number of buckets - [ ] how to provide better hints to auto-scaling so runners can pick better initial `numWorkers` instead of one - [ ] Cleanup temp files after failed writes - [x] (Potentially) Option to shard files per bucket based on a target file byte size, in case of unexpectedly skewed bucket sizes. - [ ] Make Iterables in `SMBCoGbkResult` truly lazy - [ ] Support nullable keys, with the assumption most users won't be interested in including them in the join results (some options: 1) write all nulls to a separate bucket, easy to ignore at join time; 2) don't write to a separate bucket, but include a "allowNullableKeys" field in `BucketMetadata` to identify whether keys are encoded with `NullableCoder` or not; 3) wrap all keys in `NullableCoder`. We're leaning toward (1). ) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: Fixed bug where fieldIdsAccessed order could be inconsistent with getFieldsAccessed
body:
In several places we make assumptions that `fieldIdsAccessed` returned a Set with the same iteration order as `getFieldsAccessed`, but this is not the case. Most notably this resulted in an error in `CoGroupTest` when joining by multiple keys. This bug could cause the pipeline to return results with (country, user) rather than (user, country). This PR makes `fieldIdsAccessed` collect field ids into a List instead to maintain the original order. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-6247] Remove deprecated module hadoop-input-format
body:
This module `hadoop-input-format` was deprecated in Beam 2.10 (3 releases ago), so now it's time to remove it completely to avoid additional support and Jenkins resources consuming. All Hadoop Input/Output Format functionality is implemented in `hadoop-format` which should be used instead. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-7126] Remove duplicate key encoding for state backend
body:
Unknown Coders are wrapped inside a LengthPrefixCoder to ship serialized data without knowledge of the Coder used to serialize the data. When operators use state or timers, we rely on data to be partitioned by key. We included the LengthPrefixCoder for the key Coder which led to issues with handling state requests which do not include the length prefix in the key encoding. We can safely remove the LengthPrefixCoder from the key because we do not store the key in a nested context where we might need the length prefix. This also expands the state cleanup tests to further verify that state is cleaned up correctly. title: [BEAM-7154] Updating Go SDK errors (Part 2)
body:
Updating standard Go error functionality (`errors.New` and `fmt.Errorf`) to use the newly added Beam "errors" package. This PR covers the following subdirectories under `sdks/go/pkg/beam`: `io`, `options`, `provision`, and `runners`. I tried to keep the actual changes as straightforward as possible: 1. If a call isn't wrapping another error, replace it with `New` or `Errorf`. This should be functionally identical. 2. If a call is wrapping another error, replace it with either `Wrap` or `WithContext` using my best judgement. I generally used `Wrap` when the wrapped error originates from third-party code (i.e. any non-Beam package), and I tried to use `WithContext` otherwise. 3. `WithContext` messages make the most sense in present tense (e.g. "doing foo", "reading bar"). This means I had to adjust some messages slightly, as little as I could without losing any useful information. Only PR left after this is for the `core` subdirectory. That one might be a bit large so I wanted to separate it. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-6356] Use TFRecord to store cache results using PCollection's PCoder
body:
To enable Python Interactive CacheManager to work with arbitrary types such as Google protobufs,
it should start using pcoder attached to PCollection instead of hard-coded one. It changes the file format for cache results to TFRecord to take advantage of direct writing and reading binary data.

R: @aaltay

title: [BEAM-3342] Create a Cloud Bigtable IO connector for Python
body:
The initial version of Google Cloud Bigtable IO connector. ~The connector implements BigtableSource() class as the BoundedSource, using LexicographicKeyRangeTracker() class as the corresponding RangeTracker.~ At this stage, the table is read as a whole. The two supplementary files, 'bigtableio_test.py' and 'bigtableio_it_test.py', provide the code for unit and integration tests, respectively. _Note about the unit test: As the evidence suggests, the assert_split_at_fraction_exhaustive() function of 'source_test_utils.py' fails to work properly with the LexicographicKeyRangeTracker() class. Patching the 'source_test_utils.py' eliminated some but not all of the errors. Since all the other tests are passed, including the integration test, and the issue seems to be unrelated to the BigtableSource() code, it was decided to temporarily bypass the test_dynamic_work_rebalancing() function until the 'source_test_utils.py' is fully debugged._ _Note about the integration test: The test script requires certain command line arguments. Refer to 'bigtableio_it_test.py' for more specifics._ ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-6985] TypeHints Py3 Error: Native type compatibility tests fail on Python 3.7+ Updates
body:
These changes are related to the difference in the typing module. In short the issubclass is removed for typing after python 3.5 and thus this needs to be handled. For more information about the difference and change in typing see: - https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42027923/mypy-differences-in-isinstance-and-issubclass-from-python-3-5-to-3-6-in-paramete - https://github.com/python/typing/issues/136 In order to accomplish the same behaviour as issubclass did for beam, python2 in python3 the attribute .\_\_origon\_\_ is used for some of the data structures, see below. Using .\_\_origin\_\_ result in that both parent and derived is evaluated as subclass of each other. To solve this the attribute .\_\_args\_\_ is used, _\_args\_\_ gives the arguments of the typing object. For further information see: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48572831/how-to-access-the-type-arguments-of-typing-generic The comparison is splited in the following cases: - evaluation of typing.[Dict,List,Set,Tuple], there are some special handling of Namedtuples(which is based upon the original code). The evaluation for these types are done using .\_\_orign\_\_ in order to also check the parent vs derived the attribute .\_\_args\_\_ are used to check for arguments - union evaluation of typing.Union, this case is different in the sense that typing.Union.\_\_origin\_\_ result in attribute error. However for example typing.Union[int, typing.List[int]].\_\_origin\_\_ gives typing.Union therefore the comparison is: derived.__origin__ is parent - any is compared using type ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-6859] align teardown with setup calls also for empty streaming
body:
batches This PR aligns teardown with setup calls. Currently, for empty batches in streaming for DoFns setup is called, but teardown isn't. [1] This PR removes the call to setup. An alternative implementation could be to add ```diff diff --git a/runners/spark/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/spark/translation/SparkProcessContext.java b/runners/spark/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/spark/translation/SparkProcessContext.java index 830778fe95..97a4c288d9 100644 --- a/runners/spark/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/spark/translation/SparkProcessContext.java +++ b/runners/spark/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/spark/translation/SparkProcessContext.java @@ -58,6 +58,7 @@ class SparkProcessContext { // skip if partition is empty. if (!partition.hasNext()) { + DoFnInvokers.invokerFor(doFn).invokeTeardown(); return new ArrayList<>(); } ``` This was implemented before, but the call to teardown was dropped and afterwards the call to setup was moved on some refactoring so that this issue was accidentally introduced. [1] https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-6859 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7192] Fix partitioning of buffered elements during checkpointing
body:
When a Flink checkpoint is taken, the current bundle is finalized. The finalization happens when the checkpoint barrier has already been sent downstream; emitting elements at this point would violate the checkpoint barrier alignment. When elements are emitted during checkpointing they are buffered until the checkpoint is complete. We should ensure that they are keyed correctly and emission of the buffered elements does not interfere with any concurrent state requests (in case of portability). title: [BEAM-7179] Correct file extension
body:
DATAFLOW_GRAPH_FILE_NAME (`String DATAFLOW_GRAPH_FILE_NAME = "dataflow_graph.pb"`) 's file extension is set to .pb however it is indeed a .json. The content is generated as ``` options .getStager() .stageToFile( DataflowPipelineTranslator.jobToString(newJob).getBytes(UTF_8), DATAFLOW_GRAPH_FILE_NAME); ``` see also [DataflowPipelineTranslator](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/ef67378fec2afadbe4a5303e61ac0427ced1faa0/runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/DataflowPipelineTranslator.java#L217) While the actual proto `String PIPELINE_FILE_NAME = "pipeline.pb"` is generated as ``` options.getStager().stageToFile(serializedProtoPipeline, PIPELINE_FILE_NAME); ``` ------------------------ @lukecwik Can you take a look. title: [BEAM-7154] Updating Go SDK errors (Part 1)
body:
Updating standard Go error functionality (`errors.New` and `fmt.Errorf`) to use the newly added Beam "errors" package. This PR covers the following subdirectories under `sdks/go/pkg/beam`: `artifact`, `testing`, `transforms`, and `util`. I tried to keep the actual changes as straightforward as possible: 1. If a call isn't wrapping another error, replace it with `New` or `Errorf`. This should be functionally identical. 2. If a call is wrapping another error, replace it with either `Wrap` or `WithContext` using my best judgement. I generally used `Wrap` when the wrapped error originates from third-party code (i.e. any non-Beam package), and I tried to use `WithContext` otherwise. 3. `WithContext` messages make the most sense in present tense (e.g. "doing foo", "reading bar"). This means I had to adjust some messages slightly, as little as I could without losing any useful information. This isn't the complete change of course. I still have other subdirectories to go through and change. But I wanted to try to keep each PR somewhat short since they can be merged independently and I don't want to have a really long, repetitive PR to review. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7072][SQL][Nexmark] Disable Query5
body:
SqlQuery5 is broken because it uses non-equi-joins. These queries are now rejected after #8301 . Should fix issues like https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/8422#issuecomment-487676350 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-7171] Ensure bundle finalization during Flink checkpoint
body:
Watermarks are held back during execution of a portable bundle. When a checkpoint is taken, the bundle needs to be finished to ensure consistent state. After the bundle has finished, the watermark is updated. This can trigger additional bundles which need to be finished as well. title: [BEAM-7174] Add schema modification transforms
body:
Add three transforms for modifying schemas:
**AddFields** Add new fields to a schema. Existing rows are padded with null values in the position of these new fields (or alternatively the user can specify a default value)
**DropFields** Drop fields from a schema.
**RenameFields** Rename schema fields.

title: [BEAM-7002] Fix failures in SchemaCoder
body:
There were two issues with Dataflow's proto representation of SchemaCoder:
   - It assumed that all schemas had a uuid, which was not true for nested schemas. This PR ensures that SchemaCoder gives nested schemas a uuid as well.
   - The nullable bit on FieldType was not being propagated to the proto. This caused the generated coder to do the incorrect thing, causing EOF exceptions to be thrown.
